title: Goudy Sans... original foundry?
content:
I am doing up some citations on various typefaces, and occasionally it seems as if a typeface may have been essentially "self-published." Is that the case for Frederic Goudy's [Goudy Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201123137/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Goudy%2520Sans)? Or was it perhaps issued by [Lanston](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201123137/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Lanston%2520Monotype)?

(Pfeh, if I had unpacked my copy of McGrew's "American Metal Typefaces of the Twentieth Century" since the move, I could figure this out in a jiffy, but I can't find it right now.)

T
author: Thomas Phinney

comments.content: 1930, Lanston Monotype, according to MacGrew. He started work on it in 1922 and they persuaded him to finish it in 1929.
